result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothea A Cooper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Ct 1: 961.41(1m)(i)-Possession w/intent-Schedule IV Drugs. Defendant to report to ES agent's office and get on a reporting schedule.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to be monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator) between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Deft is not to have any prescriptions w/o prior approval of court. The defendant is to report to agent and to RCAP and to sign a release allowing RCAP to be advised if deft was provided any medications. Det to make a list of all medications and the prescribers of those medications and provide the list to RCAP. Defendant is to call Mr. Hargrove w/in 24 hours and arrange an appointment with him.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Timothea A Cooper in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Defendant Timothea A Cooper in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
